Question_1.Context: The study focused on improving in vivo stability and tumor uptake of a GRPR-targeted agonist tracer through unnatural amino acid substitutions.
Question_1.Question: What was identified as a preferable modification for improving in vivo stability and tumor uptake of the GRPR-targeted agonist tracer?
Question_1.Source: Out of 25 unnatural amino acid substitutions, tert-Leu10 (Tle10) and NMe-His12 substitutions were identified to be preferable modifications especially in combination.

Question_2.Context: The study involved conducting in vitro competition binding assays to measure the inhibition constants (Ki) of GRPR-targeted ligands to GRPR.
Question_2.Question: Which substitution led to a derivative with enhanced binding affinity in the in vitro competition binding assays?
Question_2.Source: Tle10 substitution improves binding affinity (LW01080: 3.56 ± 0.72 nM) while NMe-His12 (LW01088: 9.00 ± 1.99 nM), 2-Me-Trp8 (LW02009: 11.5 ± 1.71 nM), 7-F-Trp8 (LW01177: 9.38 ± 1.68 nM) and 5-Me-Trp8 (LW01182: 10.5 ± 1.86 nM) substitutions lead to analogs with comparable binding affinities.

Question_3.Context: The study confirmed the agonist characteristics of GRPR-targeted ligands through calcium release assays.
Question_3.Question: Which substitution led to a derivative that induced Ca2+ efflux comparable to the positive control ATP?
Question_3.Source: Ga-LW01107 induced Ca2+ efflux corresponding to 1,004 ± 32.0 relative fluorescence units (RFUs), which is comparable to the positive control ATP.

Question_4.Context: The study evaluated the capability of 68Ga-labeled TacBOMB2 derivatives to target GRPR in vivo through PET imaging and biodistribution studies.
Question_4.Question: Which tracer showed the highest tumor uptake in the PET imaging and biodistribution studies?
Question_4.Source: [68Ga]Ga-LW01110 showed the highest tumor uptake (16.6 ± 1.60 %ID/g) among the evaluated tracers.

Question_5.Context: The study included LogD7.4 measurements to assess the hydrophilicity of the 68Ga-labeled tracers.
Question_5.Question: Which tracer had the most hydrophilic nature based on the LogD7.4 values?
Question_5.Source: [68Ga]Ga-LW01142 had a LogD7.4 value of -1.81, indicating a relatively higher hydrophilicity compared to the other tracers.

Question_6.Context: The study conducted in vivo stability studies to evaluate the intact fraction of the tracers in mouse plasma.
Question_6.Question: Which substitution led to a tracer with the highest intact fraction in mouse plasma at 15 minutes post-injection?
Question_6.Source: Combination of both Tle10 and NMe-His12 substitutions led to [68Ga]Ga-LW01110 with an intact fraction of ≥ 89% in mouse plasma at 15 minutes post-injection.

Question_7.Context: The study compared the tumor uptake of the tracers in ex vivo biodistribution studies.
Question_7.Question: Which tracer had the lowest uptake in the pancreas at 1 hour post-injection?
Question_7.Source: [68Ga]Ga-LW01107 showed the lowest uptake in the pancreas (0.39 ± 0.03 %ID/g) among the evaluated tracers at 1 hour post-injection.

Question_8.Context: The study compared the tumor-to-organ uptake ratios of the tracers in ex vivo biodistribution studies.
Question_8.Question: Which tracer had the highest tumor-to-pancreas uptake ratio?
Question_8.Source: [68Ga]Ga-LW01107 showed the highest tumor-to-pancreas uptake ratio (17.9 ± 1.10) among the evaluated tracers.

Question_9.Context: The study evaluated the potential of the stabilized tracers for prostate cancer imaging.
Question_9.Question: Which tracer had the best tumor-to-organ uptake ratios for tumor-to-bone, tumor-to-muscle, tumor-to-blood, tumor-to-kidney, and tumor-to-pancreas at 1 hour post-injection?
Question_9.Source: [68Ga]Ga-LW01110 had the best tumor-to-organ uptake ratios (134 ± 16.7, 119 ± 22.6, 24.7 ± 4.17, 5.10 ± 0.39, and 7.36 ± 1.17 for tumor-to-bone, tumor-to-muscle, tumor-to-blood, tumor-to-kidney, and tumor-to-pancreas, respectively) at 1 hour post-injection.

Question_10.Context: The study conducted blocking studies to assess the impact of co-injection with a blocking agent on tumor uptake.
Question_10.Question: Which tracer had its tumor uptake reduced by 44% upon co-injection with a blocking agent?
Question_10.Source: Co-injection of [D-Phe6,Leu-NHEt13,des-Met14]Bombesin(6–14) reduced the average tumor uptake of [68Ga]Ga-LW01110 by 44%.
